text:
I love this scene at the church, might be the best scene of this entire show, but there are so many choices.  You get a ton of spike's backstory all while there is complete silence with exception to this song.

For me, I don't think there will ever be anything that surpasses my first time watching Bebop.

author: Wolfangel23

text: When I was watching Cowboy Bebop for the first time, not that long ago, I always had this song playing in my head. Episode 5 "Ballad of Fallen Angels", was such a great one. Vicious and Spike battling it out until, in the end, Vicious threw Spike out of the window and this magnificent song started playing. Since that day, I've been trying to find the name of the song, but to no avail. Until today, THANKS A LOT SD.

author: MsMzphit

text: I am so happy you have this channel; it really just exemplifies all the beautiful music that is really out there from things that close-minded people refuse to accept as an art form. I recently saw Cowboy Bebop for the first time and was absolutely blown away; I am sure it will have a long term effect on me, and the music definitely helped seal the deal. Thanks for sharing all this video game/occasional anime music.
author: AbsolBlogsPokemon

text: I love this series and all of it's music until the ending, which I will not spoil here in case no one watched it.  I think it was a kind of heartbreaker ending and it also left a few things unresolved.

author: MasterChibi

text: I uploaded a track from Samurai Champloo a few months ago, so I thought I'd also post a track from Watanabe's most popular anime, Cowboy Bebop. That and I'm a big fan of Yoko Kanno, so it's an excuse to upload one of my favorite themes by her. She's always great with angelic voices (see EverLand from Ragnarok Online II, Best VGM 1134). This is a series I'd recommend even to non-anime fans.
author: SupraDarky
